venue.name: Trinity College Life Sciences Center Auditorium

item.description:
A new weekly meeting for the Hartford Spanish Meet-up!
Join international film buffs as well as Spanish language speakers and learners at Trinity College's free weekly showings of Iberian and Latin American films.

This week's film is Buena Vista Social Club, directed by Wim Wenders (1999).
Aging Cuban musicians whose talents had been virtually forgotten following Castro's takeover of Cuba, are brought out of retirement by Ry Cooder, who travelled to Havana in order to bring the musicians together, resulting in triumphant performances of extraordinary music, and resurrecting the musicians' careers. A group of legendary Cuban musicians, some as old as their nineties, were brought together by Ry Cooder to record a CD. In this film, we see and hear some of the songs being recorded in Havana. There is also footage from concerts in Amsterdam and New York City's Carnegie Hall. In addition, many of the individual musicians talk about their lives in Cuba and about how they got started in music http://www.imdb.com/t...

Film starts at 7:00 in the Life Sciences Building.
For directions to Trinity, please visit http://www.trincoll.e...
Or call (860) 297-2053.

http://www.trincoll.e...

If you can come earlier than 6:45, please join me for supper in the Cave cafeteria (basement of Mather Hall, no id required). Prices are reasonable and the food is basic. I usually get there by 5:15.

group.name: The Hartford Spanish Language Meetup Group

item.name: Film: Buena Vista Social Club
